alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 12:25PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Volusia County through 100 PM EDT... At 1225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Port Orange. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Orange, New Smyrna Beach, Samsula-Spruce Creek, Spruce Creek and Glencoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. On rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
